item.title: - Hermitian Adjoint of A
item.description: 1. Definition of $L : V \to V^*$ # $L : V \to V^*$, $v \mapsto \tilde{v}$, where $L(v)(w) = \tilde{v}(w) = (v \mid w)$ It’s important to note that $L$ is a conjugate-linear map. 2. Definition of $A^\dagger$ # $A^\dagger$ represents the Hermitian adjoint matrix of $A$ and is defined as follows. $$A^\dagger : V \to V, \quad A^\dagger = L^{-1} \circ A^T \circ L$$ Therefore, $A^\dagger(v) = L^{-1}(A^T(\tilde{v}))$.
